website_summaries.verdict: Sure to be a hit with meat-loving dogs, these freeze-dried morsels are made of premium high-protein turkey, but they should be rotated with other fiber-rich foods to prevent constipation.
pros: With a limited list of ingredients, this is a good option for allergy-prone dogs
Free of grains, fillers, gluten, hormones, and other undesirable ingredients
freeze-drying process to preserve vital nutrients
Bite-sized pellets are ideal for treats and snacks
cons: Extremely low fiber content may cause constipation if fed as a daily diet

customer_reviews.title: Short Changing the Quantity
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 1 pound bag, but when I received it, it was only about 1/3 full. I weighed it, and its less than 13 ounces (including the weight of the bag) NOT a full pound. If I pay $30+/pound, then I expect to get a full pound. Can't return it per Amazon return policy. Will never buy this product again or anything like it from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie R.

customer_reviews.title: Great product before, no more
customer_reviews.text: This used to be a stellar product. Recently they caved and started HPP of their grinds (the raw bar items are still good as far as I know, it's just the grinds) tanking the nutritional value. It was one of very few convenient options for raw feeders; now it's not an option at all. I would like to find any non-HPP bags that are left, but they don't even label that they made the change. Also concerning, if they thinks it's a good thing like they are saying (it's not), why hide the ball?? I did get a bag recently and my discerning pup who used to love the stuff, won't touch it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Sisdeh

customer_reviews.title: Say Bye, Bye to allergy issues!! Happy Fur-Babies😘
customer_reviews.text: Recently our 3 mini Shih Tzu's started experiencing allergic reactions to the food we were using. They all begun chewing their feet, itchy skin, and yeast issues!! We tried many, many foods and after reading the great reviews. We are now writing our great review. We have finished one bag & about finished with the 2nd bag. I must say once we started feeding the Vital Essentials within a short time ALL 3 are doing very well. No itchy skin, chewed up feet & the yeast issue is GONE🤗 We will be using The Vital Essentials for Now on!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Tasty for puppy
customer_reviews.text: I just received these in the mail today. My thoughts: It arrived one day late unexpectedly. They stink (good for puppy). They seem healthy (yay!) I thought they were treats (ops by bad - they aren't, but I will still use them as such). They are still too big for my 4 lb papillon puppy. She can eat them (slowly), but I will cut them all in half so I caneasily use them as treats. They have some soft white stuff inside that looks like bean mush (I have no idea what it is). I hope this is okay, but I am going to use this as half of my puppies food and give her half her regular food.
customer_reviews.author: JacobSoto

customer_reviews.title: Two paws up
customer_reviews.text: Regular part of my dog food rotation. I feed all raw dried foods to my dogs. I am a dog groomer and see what a difference proper diet makes in a dog's health and longevity everyday. I'd rather spend money on a good diet than at the vet compensating for a bad diet. My 12 y/o dog blows people away with her energy, mental alertness and overall condition. She only goes to vet for annual exams as she is healthy otherwise. She has never had a dental and has great teeth, gums and breath
customer_reviews.author: Angela G

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality limited ingredients that your dog needs and loves
customer_reviews.text: My 8lb Maltese has many sensitivities (according to our Vet) and would go up to 3 days at a time without eating. I tried many dog foods wet and dry no matter the cost and he would always react the same, sniff and maybe take a bite and walk away. Desperate to find a dog food that our Vet approves and that my Maltese will eat, my research led me to VITAL ESSENTIALS FREEZE DRIED DUCK NIBBLETS. I am amazed to see my little dog actually run to his bowl to eat this. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda V

customer_reviews.title: Poop-Eater?
customer_reviews.text: I grind up as additive to regular dog food. Use a couple of tablespoons a day. One of my dogs was a poop-eater. Tried several unsuccessful things over time. Read pure meat diet or additive might help. [...] Dog hasn't done it since starting diet. Coincidence? Maybe, but I'm thinking this was the remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog's absolute favorite treat, I work full-time as a dog trainer ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog's absolute favorite treat, I work full-time as a dog trainer and I constantly recommend this product for my clients, many dogs who were typically refused treats genuinely seem to love these ! This product is marketed as a full-time food, I use them as training treats and they work perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Jax I

customer_reviews.title: My toy dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: Good size for my little dogs. You do not have to soak it in water like other freeze-dried raw foods, unless you want to. Very crunchy without being hard.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: BEST Treat ever for my four legged kiddies!  :)
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs are crazy over these little treats! :) If they could flip, they would... and the smell isn't bad either. I also take some, in a little baggie, on our walks around the pond. It helps to train them to behave on our walks. I like the 1 pound bag too, with 3 dogs the smaller bags would disappear to quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Great Food For My Puppy
customer_reviews.text: I recently have switched kibble to this and I see the result immediately. My puppy's stool smells way less and is smaller. He sheds way less than before. He loves the food as a somewhat picky eater. Sure it is a little bit more expensive than kibbles but it makes the puppy healthier. I'd recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lu

customer_reviews.title: Hallelujah!
customer_reviews.text: My ultra picky Papillon, the one that turns his nose at everything,... He scarfed it down, like a real dog! Thank you VE, I'm trying all of your raw diet flavors for this little guy :-)
customer_reviews.author: lilsista

customer_reviews.title: Bones!!
customer_reviews.text: My little dog loves these but the fishy smell is extremely strong and there’s sharp pieces of bones I’m worried might get stuck in my small dog’s mouth, throat, or intestines. But - my dog goes cray for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pacific

customer_reviews.title: Great for Roadtrips and Dogs who eat raw dog food
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a replacement for our dogs standard raw dog food diet, while we were on the road. The dogs loved it and it made it easy to travel with and lasted for at least a few weeks with any issue of it going bad. Would definitely recommend for anyone that doesn't want to feed frozen raw dog food.

I now feed both my dogs a handful over their rx soft food each morning. My dogs are now excited for breakfast again. The rx food is not their fav, but necessary for other reasons. Side note, the first bag was only $22 and i was bummed with the $30 price tag. I am hoping the price will go down. The bag lasts about month.

That's especially important to me because I'm a professional dog walker and the last thing I want is to cause my clients' dogs to become distressed due to the treats I give them. I get the mini nibs which are perfect for giving multiple rewards. I like the fact that they don't crumble in my pocket, too. They cost a lot per pound but a bag really goes a long way, so for me they are just perfect.

product_meta.title: Vital Essentials Freeze-Dried Mini Nibs Grain Free Limited Ingredient Dog Entree, 1 Pound Bag
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:TurkeyGive your dog Thanksgiving year around with our freeze-dried grain free gluten free small Bites Turkey mini Nibs. This complete and balanced dog food is loaded with protein and good-for-your-pet nutrients – manganese, Niacin, thiamine, riboflavin, folate, iron, Zinc, copper, Phosphorus, taurine…and more. Made with only USA free run Turkey meat, organs and bones. Your dog will have a feast every day. Convenient, easy to serve, does not require rehydrating, pour into your pet's bowl and watch them disappear. Dogs feel full and satisfied with our nutrient dense food.
feature_bullets: REAL MEAT! Compare our label to any dog food! Vital Essentials is made from USA sourced, grain free, turkey meat + organs + bones, nature's recipe! Packed with protein and nutrients – manganese, niacin, thiamine, riboflavin, folate, iron, zinc, copper, phosphorous, taurine…and more providing the energy and strong immune system your dog needs to live a healthy life.
NUTRITIONAL INTEGRITY - simple, limited ingredients, our freeze-drying process removes moisture under cold pressure retaining the majority of vitamins and minerals found in fresh, raw meat.

LIGHTWEIGHT AND EASY TO CHEW - freeze dried dog food is lightweight - no 40# bag for you or your delivery person to lug around. Since the moisture has been removed your dog will enjoy an easy, crunchy, tasty dog food vs. a hard, cooked texture of traditional kibble.

DENTAL HEALTH - why do dogs have bad teeth? Starch, found in traditional dog food, causes tartar buildup, dental disease and mouth infections. Poor dental hygiene affects your dogs energy levels. The crunching of Vital Essentials gluten free, small bites, naturally assists in the removal of tartar and plaque while strengthening teeth. Crunchy, easy to chew food stimulates healthy gums, great for circulation.

LOOKING FOR NEW PUPPY FOOD? Our complete and balanced nutrition ensures you are feeding your new pup the nutrition required for strong bones and healthy coat! Our crunchy, grain free mini nibs are perfect for that new furry family addition.
FEED THEIR PRIMAL INSTINCT: remember your dog is born to eat meat, not blueberries and spinach. Our dog food is just that real protein!

HOW TO TRANSITION TO VITAL ESSENTIALS: Switch to a purely raw diet slowly as some dogs may take to raw immediately, while others a bit longer because they are hooked on the added flavorings in traditional dog food. Typically, 10 days to 2 weeks is sufficient to transition your dog’s food. This gives their digestive system time to adjust to the new food.
CERTIFIED GLUTEN FREE - All Vital Essentials dog food has received the official Certified Gluten Free Certification. (Certificate ID 68908, issued by GFCO on 2/4/19)
